reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Tulip Inn for three nights at the end of June while he was attending a conference at the university. We found the hotel to be satisfactory. They upgraded us to a "family" room with two queen size beds upon arrival. The room was clean and the bathroom was great. The beds were fine, we slept well. The hotel is located right across the street from the train station (which was perfect for us since we took day trips to the Hague and Delft) and it's a 10 min. walk back to the center of Leiden. We enjoyed our stay - it's not luxury but it didn't appear to me that Leiden has any luxury hotels (no need). Breakfast is something crazy like 15-20 Euros per person so avoid eating at the hotel if you can. We found a really great cafeteria style place (very affordable) inside the train station. You could probalby find a cheaper room in this city - but if you want to be comfortable, stay here.
reviews.title: A good stay at the Tulip Inn

likes.liked: — Big room and big clean bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I expected this hotel to be the largest and most comfortable of our trip between three hotels but I was unexpectedly disappointed. The bedspread was filthy when we arrived and had to have it replaced. The room was small and the shower was so small it was almost unusable. This was for a hotel that was the most costly of our three that we had stayed in. Definately not worth the price. The location was actually better than I had expected as it was only a short walk to the main square. I thought that I would get a room away from the main area so it would be quieter but it was next to the train station and a main road so it was actually even more noisy. I would try a smaller hotel around the main area next time. It was a short walk to the train and bus but that was the best thing about it.
reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed

reviews.text: I booked this hotel by mistake, I meant to book the Amsterdam Tulip Inn. However it turned out to be a good mistake. The hotel was wonderful. Clean rooms, and amazing breakfasts. Only 35 mins on the train to Amsterdam and appx 15 to the airport. Leiden is a beautiful town and it was good to get out of the craziness of Amsterdam. If you dont want ot be in the thick of it all the time in Amsterdam consider staying here, this is the kind of mistake i wouldnt mind doing again!
reviews.title: By mistake

likes.liked: — No coffee or tea making facilities in the rooms

reviews.title: Great |Hotel
reviews.text: As a family of five we stayed at the Tulip Inn Lieden for two nights in July 2007. I highly recommend this hotel. It is five minutes walk from Leiden Central Railway station and bus station and just five minutes walk to the main shopping area also. Our train journay from Schipol airport to Leiden took 20 minutes and only €13 for a family of five. Family room for us included two very large double beds and a pull out bed. Room was very quiet even though we were in close proximity to the railway station. Bathroom had very large deep bath and overhead shower and a silent extractor fan. Breakfast was served in the dining room of the Golden Tulip Hotel and was excellent. I highly recommend this reasonably priced hotel and it was an ideal stopover for us before travelling onwards to Dunreill Holiday Centre ( by bus 15 minutes).

reviews.title: A central spot for daytrips
reviews.text: The Tulip Inn in Leiden is located a short walk from the train station. We chose it as a base for daytrips to other points in the Netherlands (although Leiden itself is definitely worth at least a day).

The hotel is located opposite the train station in Leiden, so pretty convenient for travellers. Leiden is a small town, so you can walk to pretty much anywhere in 15 mins. The hotel has a 3-star Tulip Inn portion and a 4-star Golden Tulip portion. I stayed in the cheaper portion, which has small basic rooms, with a compact bathroom featuring a tiny shower cubicle (may be tough for bigger people to fit in!), and a 14-inch TV. Got a room not facing the station, so was pretty quiet.
reviews.title: Does the job

reviews.text: I stopped over for a day to run the Leiden Half Marathon, and take in this lovely little town before travelling to Drenthe province for work - does the job for this kind of short stopover. If you are travelling with spouse or family, you would probably prefer a little more luxury.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: Would have given it 3 stars, but the free internet (ask for a wifi code at the lobby) gets the place another star!

reviews.text: We spent three happy nights in a well appointed and clean room. Excellent shower. Breakfast and restaurant also good though dinner was perhaps rather pricey. Room a bit small but otherwise no criticism.
reviews.title: Very good choice

reviews.text: I was here for four nights to attend a conference. The accomodation was included in the package i chose.
reviews.title: Depressing Rooms

reviews.text: We stayed at the Tulip Inn on the way back from Florence. The hotel staff are really helpful. Parking is approx 9 euros per car per day. If like us you are travelling by motorcycle park at the rear on the footpath and its free. Breakfast was a little overcooked but plentiful. The rooms are spotless and appealing. Leiden itself is a beautiful City with many pretty canal side walks ans excellent restaurants. Iwill go back one day soon and will be happy to use the Tulip
reviews.title: Clean, friendly & efficient, ideal for Leiden Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room at the Golden Tulip overlooked the railway station ( the double glazed windows kept out any noise and the air con worked) but although in need of some refurbishment was clean and comfortable. The hotel staff were excellent....mainly local, pleasant and very helpful.
reviews.title: Good For Train Enthusiasts

reviews.text: We spent 3 days at the Tulip Inn and 4 days at the connected hotel The Golden tulip. You can see the train and bus station across from the hotel. It is about an 8 minute walk to the center of town and the shops. The hotel staff, speaks excellent english, were very friendly, and extremely helpful with directions. They even offered to pack us a meal, since we were missing breakfast, and it was ready to go at 5:00 AM when we left on an early excursion. There is some construction going on in front of the hotel by the train station, it might be better to ask for a room in the back. Try and book your hotel with a website that includes breakfast, otherwise you pay 16 euro. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.text: Great services & great location . Except the bed is too soft, rather old I should say. Time to change for a new bed . and also the drain is not quite working in the bathroom, told them to fixed it but they didnt bothered.
reviews.title: Great hotel, except bed is too old

reviews.text: However, I stil would like to come back to this hotel but first thing I would do is check the drain in the shower and bed.
reviews.title: Very convenient
Convenient place
reviews.text: I stayed at Tulip Inn for a full week. A convenient location, very close to the railway station and just a 5 minute walk from the centre of Leiden. The room was spacious with an ample and comfortable bathroom. The hotel looked clean. The breakfast was served in the Rubens restaurant of the Golden Tulip, a 4 star hotel (the two hotels share also the same reception). It was a buffet breakfast, Northen European type, similar to the kind I have got in German, British or Scandinavian hotels. The restaurant was elegant, and a soft baroque music was played in the background.The staff was polite. The breakfast cost was 14 euros, however I could get a good deal with the room charge. My room did not have any minibar (personally I do not care about minibars). There was a vending machine in the corridor, selling snacks, beer, soft drinks and mineral water (a can of 0.33 liters of mineral water costed 2.5 euros). During my one-week stay at the hotel, the bed linen were changed only once and only on the side I slept on. Used bath towels were instead changed daily.

Stayed two nights at this hotel in May 2006. Caught bed bugs red-handed, literally, and was bitten severely. Other service are also poor. Although advertised to have exercise room or nearby, there isn't any. Nearby facility will not take guests, only members. A very bad experience. Wonder about the 3- and 4-star rating (opposite wing of the hotel respectively).
reviews.title: Bed bugs at this hotel

reviews.text: We spent one night at the hotel and had a bad experience. We arrived late on a Sunday night and one of the two roms we were assigned was dirty so we asked to have it clean. To make a long story short we had to spend the night in one room since the other one was never cleaned. I reserved and pre payed the rooms via Internet and was never able to get a refund or a good response.
reviews.title: Really bad service
